name: Sin Cyn
instructions:
1. Add all the ingredients into a mixing glass with ice and stir until well-chilled.
2. Strain into a rocks glass over fresh ice.
description: The simple Sin Cyn cocktail combines scotch with Cynar and sweet vermouth. It’s part Rob Roy, part Boulevardier and wholly delicious.

ingredients.name: Scotch whiskey
ingredients.description: Produced in Scotland, typically made from malted barley, and aged for a minimum period in oak barrels. Scotch can be further classified into single malt, single grain, blended malt, blended grain, and blended Scotch whisky.

ingredients.name: Cynar
ingredients.description: Bitter apéritif of the amaro variety. It is made from 13 herbs and plants, predominant among which is the artichoke (Cynara scolymus), from which the drink derives its name.

ingredients.name: Sweet Vermouth
ingredients.description:
Sweet vermouth, often simply referred to as "vermouth," is a fortified and aromatized wine that is flavored with a variety of botanicals, herbs, and spices. It belongs to the category of vermouth, which includes both sweet (red) and dry (white) vermouth.

Vermouth is a wine-based product, and like wine, it should be stored in a cool, dark place, and once opened, it is often recommended to be refrigerated to maintain its freshness.
